definition: to bring relief/to alleviate (a crisis)/to dull (a pain)
slow/unhurried/sluggish/gradual/not tense/relaxed/to postpone/to defer/to stall/to stave off/to revive/to recuperate
acrobatic display (esp. on horseback) (old)/variant of 懈[xie4] and 邂[xie4] (old)
to divide/to break up/to split/to separate/to dissolve/to solve/to melt/to remove/to untie/to loosen/to open/to emancipate/to explain/to understand/to know/a solution/a dissection

sentences.english: He eased some of the strains on the poor.
Alleviating air traffic congestion is one of the major goals of the new push into high-speed rail.
sentences.chinese: 推動高鐵發展的主要目的，就是緩解空中交通的擁擠。

sentences.english: Therefore, in order to ease the pressure, Ai Fujinuma brought to the comic.
sentences.chinese: 因此，爲了緩解壓力，福原愛帶上了漫畫。

sentences.english: How to relieve symptoms of hemorrhoids in this free home health video series.
sentences.chinese: 如何緩解這個免費的家庭健康系列影片痔瘡的症狀。

sentences.english: In many cases, the condition can be completely mitigated .
sentences.chinese: 在很多情況下，病情可以完全緩解。

sentences.english: Alleviate various muscles to ache and muscle spasm.
sentences.chinese: 緩解各種肌肉痠痛及肌肉痙攣。

sentences.english: He took some anodyne to relieve the pain.
sentences.chinese: 他吃了些止痛藥來緩解疼痛。

sentences.english: Much more rainfall will be needed before droughty conditions are alleviated.
sentences.chinese: 棉區需要更多降雨以緩解旱情。

sentences.english: It is clinically divided into the stage of attack and chronic remission stage.
sentences.chinese: 臨牀上可分爲發作期和慢性緩解期。

sentences.english: Conclusion Quercetin might play a role in alleviating nerve damage induced by lead to some extent.
sentences.chinese: 結論槲皮素對鉛引起的運動功能損傷有一定緩解作用。

sentences.english: Adaptation alone will not be able to accommodate unabated climate change.
sentences.chinese: 適應氣候變化本身不能緩解強勁的氣候變化。

sentences.english: B6 vitamins can relieve some of your nausea.
sentences.chinese: 維生素B6可以緩解你的噁心症狀。

sentences.english: ObjectiveObserve the curative effect of Chinese drugs on chronic obstructive lung disease in alleviating period.
sentences.chinese: 目的觀察中藥治療慢性阻塞性肺病緩解期的臨牀療效。

sentences.english: She outlined three steps she says will help you neutralize bad mouthing competitors.
sentences.chinese: 她設計了三個步驟，幫助大家緩解惡性競爭的局面。

sentences.english: Tranquillizers help alleviate the distressing symptoms of anxiety.
sentences.chinese: 鎮靜劑有助於緩解焦慮所帶來的不安症狀。

sentences.english: Ipecac can leave you throwing up for hours.
sentences.chinese: 吐可以讓你緩解大概幾個小時。

definition: to ease (tension)/to alleviate/to moderate/to allay/to make more mild
to ease (tension)/to relax/to cause sth to relax/to alleviate/relaxed/easy and unhurried/leisurely/soothing/mild (slope)
to settle (a dispute)/to resolve/to solve/to dispose of/to dispatch
to lead to/to create/to cause/to bring about
to adjust/to regulate/to harmonize/to reconcile (accountancy etc)
slow/unhurried/sluggish/gradual/not tense/relaxed/to postpone/to defer/to stall/to stave off/to revive/to recuperate
